page.title: 19Clay Pigeon Shooting
page.content: In the valley to the east of Eastbrook Hay Farm where there is the chalk dell, there is a clay pigeon shooting ground.{"Clay pigeons"}(which are now made of brittle plastic and shaped like plates) are catapulted into the air and men with shotguns try to hit them. They score 3 points if they hit it with the first shot and 2 points if they hit with the second. They catapult the clays in different ways to{simulate the flight of {different sorts of birds (Pheasant, {Partridge, Pigeon etc.)}5 men stand at stations in an arc and take turns to shoot, shouting "Pull!" when they are ready. They each have 5 shots from each station, making{25 shots in each {competition.}One of the clubs charges Â£10 annual membership and Â£10 for a shoot including cartridges. Shotguns cost from Â£60.
